sentences: Valerie Olukemi A "Kemi" Olusanya (13 October 1963 â€“ 25 April 1999), commonly known by her stage name Kemistry,  was a leading English drum and bass DJ of the early 1990s, half of duo Kemistry & Storm, and co-founder of the Metalheadz record label.
Born in Birmingham, Olusanya grew up in Kettering, Northamptonshire, and began a career as a make-up artist before giving it up for DJing in the early 1990s.
She was half of the DJ and recording duo, Kemistry & Storm, which she formed with an old friend when they both lived in London.
At 2:30 am on 25 April 1999, Olusanya was a front-seat passenger in a car travelling on the M3 motorway in Hampshire, behind a van which dislodged a cat's eye in the road.
The track "Kemistry" by Goldie, originally released in 1992 when they were in a relationship together, and also featured on his 1995 album Timeless, is dedicated to her.
